meta.description: Template for creating characters in the Willow Creek universe
meta.instructions: Copy the 'character_template' object for each new character. Fill in all fields. Add characters to the 'characters' array.

character_template._comment: Copy this template for each character. Remove this _comment field.

appearance.first_impression: What people notice first about them

current_situation.residence: Where do they live? (Use neighborhood from lore)
current_situation.workplace: Where do they work? (Use location from lore)

relationships._comment: Add relationship entries for each significant connection

relationship_template.feelings: How this character feels about them

speech_and_behavior.speaking_style: How do they talk? Formal, casual, verbose, terse?

interests.music_taste: What kind of music do they like?
interests.media_preferences: Books, movies, TV shows they enjoy

appearance.hair_style: Always perfectly coiffed in an elegant updo
appearance.typical_clothing: Elegant but dated - cardigans, skirts, always proper
appearance.first_impression: Regal and intimidating despite her age

desires: To find someone worthy to inherit
To solve the mystery of what happened to her brother
pet_peeves: People who don't respect the old ways

background.family_background: Direct descendant of town founder. Last surviving member of main Whitmore line. Never married - was engaged once but fiancé died in WWII.
background.education: Finished school in Portland, attended one year of college before returning to care for her mother

significant_events.impact: Never pursued romance again, devoted herself to family and town
Spent years trying to find out what happened, never got closure
Weight of being the end of the line, obsession with legacy

secrets: Knows more about the Peterson disappearance than she lets on
Has a will that would surprise everyone

current_situation.residence: Whitmore Estate, 1 Whitmore Lane, Old Town
current_situation.household: Lives alone with one housekeeper who comes daily
current_situation.daily_routine: Rises early, reads the paper, tends to correspondence, tea at 4pm, early to bed
current_goals: Find someone to leave the estate to

friends.feelings: Genuine fondness, one of few equals

professional.history: Martha's mother worked for the family too

antagonists.tension: He's waiting for her to die

speech_and_behavior.speaking_style: Formal, measured, with occasional dry wit
speech_and_behavior.body_language: Erect posture despite age, direct eye contact, minimal gestures
speech_and_behavior.how_they_laugh: Rare, quiet, refined - more of a knowing smile
speech_and_behavior.how_they_show_anger: Gets very quiet and cold, cutting remarks

hobbies: Garden (though she can't tend it herself now)
interests.music_taste: Classical, Big Band from her youth
interests.media_preferences: Mysteries (Agatha Christie), historical non-fiction, local newspaper

story_hooks.main_arc: The last Whitmore deciding the fate of her family's legacy and the secrets she'll take to the grave - or reveal
story_hooks.internal_conflict: Duty to family legacy vs. desire for the truth to come out
story_hooks.external_conflict: Pressure to sell estate, failing health, no heirs
story_hooks.potential_growth: Learning to let go, trust someone new, reveal long-held secrets

roleplay_guidance.how_to_write_them: Dignified but human. She's formidable but lonely. Her formality is armor. Show glimpses of the young woman she was. She observes everything and forgets nothing.

dialogue_examples.dialogue: You must be new to Willow Creek. I knew your predecessors in that position, both of them. Sit down, I'll have Martha bring tea, and you can tell me what brings you to my door.
There are things in this town's history that are better left undisturbed. But then again... perhaps it's time. I won't be here to see the consequences much longer.

reactions.to_compliments: Accepts graciously but deflects - 'The Whitmores have always tried to serve the community.'
reactions.to_criticism: Cool silence, then a pointed observation that makes the critic uncomfortable
reactions.to_strangers: Polite but assessing. She's deciding if you're worth her time.
reactions.to_conflict: Refuses to raise her voice. Gets quieter and more cutting.
reactions.to_good_news: Measured pleasure, a genuine smile that softens her whole face
reactions.to_bad_news: Stillness, then practical questions about what must be done

metadata.notes: Repository of town secrets. Can be used to reveal plot information. Represents old Willow Creek.

household_template._comment: Use this to define family/household units
household_template.household_dynamics: Description of how the household functions

character_checklist: Does this character have clear motivations?
Do they have both strengths and flaws?
Do they fit into Willow Creek's world logically?
Do they have potential for interesting stories?
Is their background consistent with their personality?
Do they have connections to other characters?
Are there hooks for interaction with other characters?
Do they have room to grow and change?
characters: _comment: Add your completed characters here as objects following the template above
